poem:
Title: Unraveling the Enigma

In the shadow of Herzog
transcripts of true tale unfold,
a revelation not two score,
full of chill German pathos told.

Kaspar Hauser, a strange enigma,
cinema's anniversary child,
survival as stark as stark stigma,
death, that master, wild.

In the mirror of history's embrace,
bold brilliance plays its part,
Herzog, orchestrating with grace,
orchid blooming from the heart.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Enigma of Kaspar Hauser review – Herzog’s early masterpiece is bold and brilliant Werner Herzog’s enduringly gripping and influential movie is rereleased for its 50th anniversary; it is Herzog’s early masterpiece, a bold and brilliant retelling of a strange true story from German history, plainly and candidly staged, full of poignancy, and pathos as well as mystery, but which is also revealed here to be about the arbitrary nature of survival and death. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Enigma of Kaspar Hauser review – Herzog’s early masterpiece is bold and brilliant Werner Herzog’s enduringly gripping and influential movie is rereleased for its 50th anniversary; it is Herzog’s early masterpiece, a bold and brilliant retelling of a strange true story from German history, plainly and candidly staged, full of poignancy, and pathos as well as mystery, but which is also revealed here to be about the arbitrary nature of survival and death.
